word.entryDescription: a small room that carries people up and down inside a building
word.entryExample: I took the lift to the tenth floor.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to think that something is good or nice
word.entryExample: I really like your dress, Kim.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to like something the most
word.entryExample: Which chocolate do you like best - milk, dark or white?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: an animal like a very large cat that lives in Africa
word.entryExample: Many people say that lion is the king of all animals.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to pay attention to what somebody is saying, a sound, a piece of music, etc
word.entryExample: We listen to a story in the afternoon.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to pay attention to what somebody is saying, a sound, a piece of music, etc
word.entryExample: I like listening to audiobooks on the bus.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: not much or enough
word.entryExample: There's little to do in this village.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to stay in a place
word.entryExample: The parrot lived on the island.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a room where people sit and relax
word.entryExample: We watch television in the living room.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a reptile with legs, a long body and a long tail
word.entryExample: It's not a baby crocodile, it's a lizard.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the capital city of England and Britain
word.entryExample: I live in London.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: something that is long measures a big distance from one end to the other
word.entryExample: I've got long brown hair.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to use your eyes so you can see something
word.entryExample: Look at the board.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to take care of or be responsible for
word.entryExample: I must look after Ann's cat this weekend.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to try to find
word.entryExample: Please help me look for my glasses.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a large road vehicle used to carry many things or heavy loads
word.entryExample: Sam's uncle is a lorry driver.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to be unable to find
word.entryExample: Be careful - don't lose your money.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: (past tense of 'to lose') to be unable to find
word.entryExample: Cinderella couldn't find her shoe. It was lost.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a large quantity
word.entryExample: We always have lots of vegetables for dinner.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: making a big sound
word.entryExample: Turn the music down â€“ it's too loud!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: with much sound
word.entryExample: Could you speak more loudly, please?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to have a strong feeling for someone, or to like something very much
word.entryExample: She loves singing old songs.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: very pleasant
word.entryExample: We've got a lovely, white cat at home.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the food you eat in the middle of the day
word.entryExample: Would you like a salad for lunch?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to produce or create
word.entryExample: Mum makes dinner in the evening.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to do something that is not correct or not a good idea
word.entryExample: Yesterday I made a mistake in my homework.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to put the covers on your bed in a tidy position
word.entryExample: What time do you make your bed at weekends?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: an adult male human being
word.entryExample: Mr Smith a very kind man.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a round tropical fruit with a thin yellow, green or red skin and a juicy yellow flesh
word.entryExample: This mango is juicy and delicious.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a drawing of an area which shows countries, rivers, roads, cities, etc
word.entryExample: Polly dropped the treasure map into the sea.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a place where lots of people sell things at different tables
word.entryExample: You can buy fruit and vegetables at the market.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a small piece of strong material that covers and protects part of a floor
word.entryExample: There's a mat in front of the sofa.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the study of numbers
word.entryExample: Maths is a very important subject.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: food which comes from the flesh of animals
word.entryExample: I don't eat meat.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to arrange to go to a place and see another person
word.entryExample: Meet me at the sports centre at 10 o'clock.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: 12 o'clock in the night
word.entryExample: The fairy godmother said, 'Come home at midnight'.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a white liquid which comes from cows
word.entryExample: Do you take milk in your tea?
word.label: ydp

word.entryExample: The pen is mine.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a period of 60 seconds; a sixtieth of an hour
word.entryExample: The bus takes 15 minutes.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a flat glass object you use to see yourself in
word.entryExample: The mirror is on the wall opposite the door.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: not in the place you think something should be
word.entryExample: The presents were missing, but we found them.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a small telephone that you can carry with you
word.entryExample: Don't use your mobile phone at the cinema!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the day between Sunday and Tuesday
word.entryExample: Who likes getting up early on Mondays?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: notes and coins you use to buy things
word.entryExample: I haven't got any money in the bank.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: an animal with a long tail that likes climbing trees
word.entryExample: Look at this funny little monkey!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a frightening creature, particularly an imaginary one
word.entryExample: I'd like to see this new monster film.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: one of the twelve periods of about four weeks that the year is divided into
word.entryExample: It's my best friend's birthday next month.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the round object that moves around the earth every 28 days, and that you can often see at night
word.entryExample: The sky is clear and you can see the moon.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the earliest part of the day, particularly from when the sun rises until midday
word.entryExample: In the morning I get up and have a shower.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: more than anything else
word.entryExample: Which is the most expensive, the plane or the train?
word.label: ydp
